intro: Pouteria adolfi-friederici, commonly known as the Brazilian peach or cupuaçu, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a distinctive, hairy fruit that resembles a peach in appearance. The fruit contains a rich, creamy pulp that is used in various food products and traditional medicines. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts within its native habitat.
